sites.name: Grote Markt
sites.description: The heart of Haarlem, featuring the stunning St. Bavo's Church, City Hall, and historic buildings. Home to the famous Saturday market and various festivals throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Weekly market on Saturday. More lively in summer with outdoor cafes and events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Many cafes and restaurants around the square.

sites.name: St. Bavo's Church (Grote Kerk)
sites.description: A magnificent Gothic cathedral known for its famous MÃ¼ller organ, played by Mozart and Handel. Features stunning architecture and historical significance.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Organ concerts throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for regular visits. Check schedule for organ concerts.

sites.name: Frans Hals Museum
sites.description: World-renowned museum featuring the works of Dutch Golden Age painter Frans Hals and other masters. Located in a historic building with beautiful gardens.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Teylers Museum
sites.description: The oldest museum in the Netherlands, featuring art, science, and natural history collections in a beautiful 18th-century building.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Haarlemmerhout
sites.description: The oldest public park in the Netherlands, featuring beautiful walking paths, a deer park, and historic pavilions. Perfect for picnics and outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring and summer. Popular for festivals.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Accessible 24/7.

sites.name: Amsterdamse Poort
sites.description: The last remaining city gate of Haarlem, dating back to the 14th century. A striking example of medieval architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Best viewed during daylight.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed.

sites.name: Corrie ten Boom House
sites.description: Historic house where the ten Boom family hid Jews during WWII. Now a museum telling their story of resistance and faith.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Guided tours available.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking required for guided tours.

sites.name: Jopenkerk
sites.description: A craft brewery located in a former church, offering tours and tastings of their traditional Dutch beers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special events and seasonal beers available.
sites.booking_tips: Tours available by appointment. Restaurant open daily.

sites.name: Sint-Bavokerk
sites.description: A beautiful Gothic church with a rich history and impressive architecture. Known for its organ concerts and cultural events.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Regular organ concerts.
sites.booking_tips: Check schedule for special events and concerts.

sites.name: Haarlem Public Library
sites.description: A modern library building with extensive collections, study spaces, and regular cultural events.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Various events throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general access.

sites.name: Windmill De Adriaan
sites.description: A reconstructed windmill on the Spaarne River, offering insights into traditional Dutch windmill technology and history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March to October. Weather dependent.
sites.booking_tips: Check opening hours before visiting.

sites.name: Dolphinarium
sites.description: A marine mammal park featuring dolphin shows, sea lions, and other marine life. Educational programs and interactive experiences available.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Show schedule varies by season.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended for shows.

sites.name: Haarlemmer Kweektuin
sites.description: A historic botanical garden featuring various plant species, greenhouses, and educational programs.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring and summer. Limited appeal in winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Guided tours available by appointment.

sites.name: Philharmonie Haarlem
sites.description: A modern concert venue hosting classical music performances, jazz concerts, and cultural events.
sites.seasonal_notes: Performance schedule varies throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended for concerts.

sites.name: Haarlem City Hall
sites.description: A historic building in the Grote Markt, featuring beautiful architecture and regular exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check for special events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed for general access.

sites.name: Museum van de Geest
sites.description: An award-winning museum focused on the mind, mental health, and the history of psychiatry. Features art and exhibitions exploring human consciousness.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended.

sites.name: Hofje van Noblet
sites.description: A beautiful historic courtyard from 1760 with gardens, sculptures, and historic houses. Features the Noblet family coat of arms and a clock on the facade.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open Monday-Saturday 10am to 5pm, closed on Sundays. Most beautiful in spring and summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed.

sites.name: Proveniershof
sites.description: One of Haarlem's most famous hofjes (courtyards), located in the busy Grote Houtstraat shopping area. Features beautiful gardens and historic architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and summer when gardens are in bloom.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Remember this is a residential area so be respectful.

sites.name: De Hallen Haarlem
sites.description: A contemporary art museum housed in the historic Vleeshal building on Grote Markt. Features modern and contemporary art exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Rotating exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Check exhibition schedule before visiting.

sites.name: Spaarnwouderpoort
sites.description: An ancient city gate also known as the Amsterdamse Poort, dating from the 14th century. One of the oldest remaining structures in Haarlem.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed.
